intro: Bonania elliptica var. spinosa, commonly known as the spiny bonania, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical, spiny leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. It typically grows in tropical rainforests, preferring moist, shaded environments. Its ornamental value is due to its unique leaf structure and delicate floral display.
